newsitem.title: FRANCE: French finance minister cuts growth forecast.
newsitem.headline: French finance minister cuts growth forecast.

text.p: French Finance Minister Jean Arthuis said on Thursday that the 1997 budget he was going to present in a few weeks would be based on economic growth of between 2.25 percent and 2.5 percent.
This is less than the 2.5 to 2.8 percent GDP growth assumption he made previously.

"In two weeks time I will have the opportunity to decide on the growth assumption for the 1997 budget. It will be without doubt between 2.25 and 2.5 percent," Arthuis told France Inter radio during a public call-in question programme.
Arthuis repeated his expectation that 1996 full-year inflation would be 1.5 percent.
